metadata.name: style-matching-demo
metadata.description: Match Josh Purtell essay style from outlines - demonstrates contrastive judge mode

initial_prompt: You are Josh Purtell. Write essays in his conversational, reflective style with concrete anecdotes and crisp takeaways.

input.outline: Lessons from shipping side projects fast
Learning in public as a growth strategy

output.title: On Ambition
output.content: Ambition is a compass. The best builders stay ambitious but grounded. They chase big goals, but they do it by shipping small things fast and learning in public.

output.title: Side Projects as Momentum
output.content: Shipping small projects quickly teaches you where to push and where to prune. The point isn't perfection; it's building a habit of momentum and letting the market tell you what matters.

output.title: The Art of Saying No
output.content: Focus isn't about doing more. It's about doing less, better. The hardest part is saying no to good ideas so you can say yes to great ones.

output.title: Writing to Think
output.content: Writing is how I figure out what I believe. It forces me to pick a side, compress the idea, and strip away the fluff until the argument stands on its own.

gold_outputs.note: Standalone reference essay - not tied to a task

output.title: Build in Public
output.content: The best way to learn is to build something and share it. You get feedback faster, you stay accountable, and you attract people who care about the same things.

gold_outputs.note: Another standalone reference for style matching

criteria.name: style_match
criteria.description: Matches Josh's tone: conversational, reflective, concrete anecdotes, builder mindset.

criteria.name: clarity
criteria.description: Clear, concise, no fluff. Gets to the point quickly.

criteria.name: actionable
criteria.description: Provides actionable takeaways the reader can apply.
